result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Bradford D. Behrens was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 1 day, if revoked.

Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Ignition Interlock Exemption was done on the 2006 Harley Davidson.
Defendant's IID was installed on 11/21/2014
Victim Impact Panel meeting was completed on 8/20/2014.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL OF 2,236.86 WAS APPLIED TO FINE.
Remaining Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

BAIL APPLIED.  DNA AND BLOOD DRAW COSTS PAID IN FULL.
Blood costs to be forwarded to Village of Summit Police dept.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Continue with treatment currently involved in.
Count 2 was dismissed outright.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - nonoworking hours. Release for work and treatment.

AS OF 1/30/2015: Court AMENDS Defendant may serve his remaining sentence (Condition Time) in Walworth County. Also to be released for alcohol treatment on Thursdays from 6pm - 7:30pm.
